pv_evaluation.metrics#

Contents#

Cluster metrics#

rand_score

Compute the Rand index.

adjusted_rand_score

Compute the adjusted Rand index.

cluster_precision

Compute cluster precision, i.e. the proportion of predicted clusters with no erroneous assignment.

cluster_recall

Compute cluster recall, i.e. the proportion of reference clusters that are not split accross different predicted clusters.

cluster_precision_recall

Cluster precision and cluster recall tuple.

cluster_homogeneity

Cluster homogeneity score (based on conditional entropy).

cluster_completeness

Cluster completeness score (based on conditional entropy)

cluster_fowlkes_mallows

Geometric mean between cluster precision and cluster recall.

cluster_fscore

F-score between cluster precision and cluster recall.

cluster_v_measure

Compute the V-measure.

cluster_sizes

Get cluster sizes for a given membership vector.

clusters_count

Compute number of clusters for a given membership vector.

Pairwise metrics#

pairwise_precision

Pairwise precision: number of correct links divided by the number of predicted links.

pairwise_recall

Pairwise recall: number of correct links divided by the number of reference links.

pairwise_precision_recall

Pairwise precision and recall

pairwise_fowlkes_mallows

Geometric mean between pairwise precision and recall.

pairwise_fscore

Pairwise precision-recall f-score.

false_positives_count

Number of false positives for given predicted and reference clusterings.

links_count

Number of links associated with a given membership vector.

true_positives_count

Number of true positives for given predicted and reference clusterings.

Documentation#

Performance evaluation metrics

pv_evaluation.metrics.adjusted_rand_score(prediction, reference)[source]#

Compute the adjusted Rand index.

This wraps scikit-learn’s adjusted rand score function <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.adjusted_rand_score.html#sklearn-metrics-adjusted-rand-score>.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

adjusted rand index

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_completeness(prediction, reference)[source]#

Cluster completeness score (based on conditional entropy)

This wraps scikit-learn’s completeness score function <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.completeness_score.html>.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

completeness score

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_fowlkes_mallows(prediction, reference)[source]#

Geometric mean between cluster precision and cluster recall.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

geometric mean between cluster precision and cluster recall.

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_fscore(prediction, reference, beta=1.0)[source]#

F-score between cluster precision and cluster recall.

This is indexed by a parameter beta representing the statement that “recall is beta times more important than precision”. See [this Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F-score) for more information.

For beta = 1 (default value), this is the harmonic mean between precision and recall.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

  • beta (float, optional) – weight. Defaults to 1.0.

Returns

f-score

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_homogeneity(prediction, reference)[source]#

Cluster homogeneity score (based on conditional entropy).

This wraps scikit-learn’s homogeneity score function <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.homogeneity_score.html>.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

homogeneity score

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_precision(prediction, reference)[source]#

Compute cluster precision, i.e. the proportion of predicted clusters with no erroneous assignment.

A cluster makes an erroneous assignment if it contains two mention ids that are not part of the same reference cluster.

A perfect cluster precision means that all predicted links are correct.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

cluster precision

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before cluster precision is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_precision_recall(prediction, reference)[source]#

Cluster precision and cluster recall tuple.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

(cluster precision, cluster recall)

Return type

tuple

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before metrics are computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_recall(prediction, reference)[source]#

Compute cluster recall, i.e. the proportion of reference clusters that are not split accross different predicted clusters.

A perfect cluster recall means that all reference links are correctly predicted.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

cluster recall

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before cluster recall is computed.

  • This is the same as `cluster_precision(reference, prediction)`_.

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_sizes(membership_vect)[source]#

Get cluster sizes for a given membership vector.

Parameters

membership_vect (Series) – membership vector, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing cluster assignment.

Returns

cluster sizes

Return type

Series

pv_evaluation.metrics.cluster_v_measure(prediction, reference, beta=1.0)[source]#

Compute the V-measure.

This wraps scikit-learn’s V-measure function <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.v_measure_score.html#sklearn-metrics-v-measure-score>.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

V-measure

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.

Compute number of clusters for a given membership vector.

Parameters

membership_vect (Series) – membership vector, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing cluster assignment.

Returns

number of clusters

Return type

int

pv_evaluation.metrics.false_positives_count(prediction, reference)[source]#

Number of false positives for given predicted and reference clusterings.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

Number of false positives

Return type

int

pv_evaluation.metrics.links_count(membership_vect)[source]#

Number of links associated with a given membership vector.

There is one link for each distinct pair of elements within the same cluster.

Parameters

membership_vect (Series) – membership vector, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing cluster assignment.

Returns

number of links

Return type

int

pv_evaluation.metrics.pairwise_fowlkes_mallows(prediction, reference)[source]#

Geometric mean between pairwise precision and recall.

See [this Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fowlkes%E2%80%93Mallows_index) for more information.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

Fowlks-Mallows index

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before the fowlks-mallows score is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.pairwise_fscore(prediction, reference, beta=1.0)[source]#

Pairwise precision-recall f-score.

This is indexed by a parameter beta representing the statement that “recall is beta times more important than precision”. See [this Wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F-score) for more information.

For beta = 1 (default value), this is the harmonic mean between precision and recall.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

  • beta (float) – weight. Defaults to 1.0.

Returns

f-score

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before f-score is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.pairwise_precision(prediction, reference)[source]#

Pairwise precision: number of correct links divided by the number of predicted links.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

pairwise precision

Return type

float

Note

The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before precision is computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.pairwise_precision_recall(prediction, reference)[source]#

Pairwise precision and recall

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

tuple (precision, recall).

Return type

tuple

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before precision and recall are computed.

pv_evaluation.metrics.pairwise_recall(prediction, reference)[source]#

Pairwise recall: number of correct links divided by the number of reference links.

Parameters

  • prediction (Series) – membership vector for predicted clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing predicted cluster assignment.

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

pairwise recall

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before recall is computed.

  • This is the same as `pairwise_precision(reference, prediction)`_.

Compute the Rand index.

This wraps scikit-learn’s rand index function <https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.metrics.rand_score.html#sklearn.metrics.rand_score>.

Parameters

  • reference (Series) – membership vector for reference clusters, i.e. a pandas Series indexed by mention ids and with values representing reference cluster assignment.

Returns

rand index

Return type

float

Notes

  • The prediction and reference membership vectors are inner joined before this metric is computed.
